video.title: Blockchain Development: Querying with Open APIs Course
video.description:
In this blockchain development course, you will learn how to query on the blockchain and build open APIs. This course will teach you how to build your own distributed applications using The Graph. It's like Lego blocks for composing your own protocols. You'll learn how to build your own APIs that query Ethereum, IPFS, and other data sources.

💻 Code: https://github.com/kubowania/foundation-app-subgraph

✏️ Ania Kubów created this course. Check out her channel: https://www.youtube.com/aniakubow

🎉 The course was made possible through a grant from The Graph.

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (00:00) Intro
⌨️ (00:58) What we will cover
⌨️ (02:44) What is The Graph for?
⌨️ (06:40) SubGraphs
⌨️ (07:20) SubGraph Manifests
⌨️ (09:36) Why build a SubGraph?
⌨️ (11:11) Let’s build a SubGraph!
⌨️ (29:47) Querying from a Frontend
⌨️ (39:33) API Key Management

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Raymond Odero
👾 Agustín Kussrow
👾 aldo ferretti
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Aleksandr Frolov
topLevelComment.text:
Yeah. decentralization ahoy. need search? let's index it and put it into one centralized place... index still needs to be collected, maintened, it still needs to scale with use, it needs backups..... where this all infrastructure lives? (oh no, that's the evil platform - cloudflare 😱)

how does it stores data? how it optimizes queries? magic? sure it's faster than to scan blockchain from scratch every time, but it such a big step back from decades of experience of "traditional development"

topLevelComment.author: Aleksandr Frolov
topLevelComment.text: I'm dying to see how this "world without platforms and big tech companies"  will go on on creating hardware, software, datacenters, fiber optic lines, satellite networks. how it will be all maintained

topLevelComment.author: Pranav Nyavanandi
topLevelComment.text: Hello. Can someone explain in simple terms what Blockchain Development means? I'm unfamiliar with the topic. For context, I am a novice programmer, I'm good with the basics of C and quite decent in Python. I have a decebt grasp of basic data structures and algorithms. Thanks.

replies.author: Vedran Vidaković
replies.text: If you're familiar with different data structures you should be familiar with linked lists. Now picture a blockchain like a giant linked list made of objects with different ID's. Every of these objects has functions for e.g. transferring money as well as data from different transactions that have taken place in the past. Now think about making it work as fast as possible on as few nodes as possible and implementing different things like NFT's, Tokens etc.. That's blockchain development

topLevelComment.author: 蒼
topLevelComment.text:
I usually use Python so I don't know these kinds of languages a lot. I faced a problem when I tried to do 'graph build'. It says

 × Failed to load subgraph from subgraph.yaml: Error in subgraph.yaml:

  Path: dataSources > 0 > eventHandlers > 0
  Event with signature 'TokenIPFSPathUpdated(indexed uint256, indexed string, string)' not present in ABI 'Token'.



I watched this video so many times so I think that I don't have  basic error such as spelling mistake. I really want to learn web3 but most of videos are described in  languages that I'm not familiar. If anyone know the solution, please help me.

replies.author: 蒼
replies.text: @Hans Cristian thanks a lot!!! I'm gonna try it right now

replies.author: Hans Cristian
replies.text: i got those errors too and i manage to fix it by changing this TokenIPFSPathUpdated(indexed uint256, indexed string, string) to TokenIPFSPathUpdated(indexed uint256,indexed string,string). it turns out that the spacing matters, hope it helps
